message: I'm all about beer. It used to be weaker European lagers (Carlsberg, etc) but that's not as readily available in the US (not a fan of Bud, etc) so it's usually something darker like Anchor Steam. Since moving here I also drink vodka and tonic on occasion (safer on hangovers, I find)

It's Happy Hump Day and it's time for a beverage of your choice. Alcoholic or non-alcoholic, what's your go-to end of the day drink?  Mine is usually a nice, dry white wine, but on occasion, I've been known to enjoy a vodka martini (shaken, not stirred). And the way this day is going, I'm going to have one of those two things tonight. What about you?
Either a nice beer (a Leinenkugel's if I can find it) or a glass of whiskey...I'm also kind of fond of a nice glass of merlot.
@spencer That's surprising - I see Carlsberg around here in just about every liquor store (we're in MN).
Cognac, VSOP or better. Preferably Hine.
@blogkitten oh, yeah, I mean on tap in bars :-)
I've been enjoying Scotch lately...Laphroaig, Macallan, Glenlivet, Glenfiddich, McClelland's, etc...
Saporro at home. Nice and crisp :-p
<--- sounding like an alcoholic now. Different drinks for different places?!
Wine at home or when eating out... beer if at a bar...
Fernet Branca & coca cola, what else?
Way late on this one but......nice cold PBR or dirty martini
